Posts.Content: Dec 30, 2008 01:05PM mommycjk wrote: Beesie,     Since you are familiar with fibrocystic breasts can some women get them worse or have them while lactating? I am lactating and my breasts are very lumpy, one side is worse than the other. I do have a lump (I have posted a topic prior about to biopsy or not) that has been called to my attention greatly lately. Ultrasound and Mammogram were bi-rads2 benign with "diffusely nodular parenchyma" Lump showed up very lucent on mammogram which suggested to radiologist that it was a lipoma possibly but my final report didn't mention that- he just said so in the conference with him after films were taken. My lump does seem to change in my size, my husband thinks so as well. However, my breast tissue around the lump is also always changing size because I'm lactating. Thanks:)
Posts.Title: How old can you get breast cancer? kaiselina miss-di

Posts.Content: Dec 29, 2008 09:51PM mommycjk wrote: I posted a earlier topic- to biopsy or not. Everyone seems to think this is benign, but I'm debating on getting it biopsied. I just hate the wait. I really want this nightmare to be over with. I'm young, only 24 and I have 3 children ages 4, 3, and 4 months. They said during the ultrasound and mammogram that I have diffusely nodular parenchyma (I am also lactating). I do have several lumps in the same breast. They mentioned fibrocystic breast disease. My OB was comfortable with waiting until March and doing a re-evalulation. I am debating on whether I would just know now and get it over with. I'm very educated in the healthcare field, and I feel that we make the worst patients. I'm such a worry-wort! Read my earlier post, it describes the lump and everything. Yesterday it felt smaller than today.
